meanings.definition: A person or thing that aligns.
meanings.sent1: The aliners in the factory ensure everything is in a straight line.
meanings.sent2: I need an aliners to help me straighten these shelves.
meanings.sent3: The aliners at the dance competition made sure the performers stayed in sync.
meanings.sent4: She was like an aliners, bringing order to the chaotic situation.
meanings.sent5: The precision of the aliners made the final product flawless.

meanings.definition: A device used to align objects.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used an aliners to adjust the car's alignment.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new aliners to help me hang pictures evenly.
meanings.sent3: The aliners beeped when the shelves were perfectly aligned.
meanings.sent4: The aliners acted like a magic wand, fixing the crooked frame instantly.
meanings.sent5: With the help of the aliners, the construction team completed the project on time.

meanings.definition: A group of people who align with a particular ideology or belief.
meanings.sent1: The aliners of the club all shared the same passion for environmental conservation.
meanings.sent2: She found her aliners in the book club who loved mystery novels.
meanings.sent3: The aliners at the protest chanted slogans in unison.
meanings.sent4: The aliners were like a family, supporting each other through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The aliners worked together to achieve their common goal of social justice.
